ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Sudden Sensorineural Hearing Loss (Right Ear)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Patient reported sudden onset of hearing loss 2 weeks ago; audiometry confirms sensorineural loss.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Chronic Mixed Hearing Loss (Left Ear)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Long-standing history of chronic ear infections and mastoidectomy; audiometry shows mixed loss with air-bone gaps.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To determine the degree, configuration, and type of hearing loss given the sudden onset.
To assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.
To evaluate middle ear function and rule out conductive pathology in the right ear.
To assess the integrity of the reflex arc and screen for retrocochlear pathology.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The right ear exhibits a mild sensorineural hearing loss sloping to severe, with word recognition scores showing slight difficulty (78%). The left ear shows a severe mixed hearing loss sloping to profound, consistent with the history of mastoidectomy. Immittance testing indicates normal middle ear function on the right (Type A) but could not be performed on the left due to surgery. Acoustic reflexes are present ipsilaterally on the right but absent in all other conditions.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Mild SNHL (250-2000 Hz) sloping to moderate-to-severe (3000-8000 Hz). Left ear: Severe mixed loss (250-3000 Hz) sloping to profound (4000-8000 Hz).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: SRT 35 dB HL, WRS 78%. Left ear: SRT 73 dB HL, WRS 64%.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Normal (Type A). Left ear: Could not be measured due to previous otosurgery.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Right ipsilateral reflexes present (normal at 500, 1000, 4000 Hz; elevated at 2000 Hz). Left ipsilateral and all contralateral reflexes absent.

proposed_items: Use of hearing protection in noise
counseling_actions: Counseling on the sudden nature of the right ear hearing loss
Discussion of realistic expectations for amplification given the mixed and sensorineural losses

escalation.rationale_short: Sudden onset of sensorineural hearing loss requires immediate medical evaluation and potential steroid treatment.

follow_up_plan.timeline: After completion of steroid course (approx. 12 days)
follow_up_plan.objective: To monitor for improvement in hearing thresholds or speech recognition following medical treatment.

expected_outcome: Pure-tone thresholds did not improve following the course of oral steroids.
Word recognition score (WRS) in the right ear increased to 96%.
Further medical management was not recommended.
